description: This crash occurred on a two lane undivided roadway slightly curving to the left with no grade and a posted speed limit of  72KMPH (45MPH). This crash occurred on a weekday afternoon.Vehicle #1, a 1988 Ford Mustang, was traveling westbound on the two lane undivided roadway when it observed Vehicle #2, a 1985 Kawasaki motorcycle, in its westbound lane traveling east.  Vehicle #1 crossed over the left lane line into the eastbound lane. The motorcycle returned to its original eastbound lane whereupon Vehicle #1 impacted with Vehicle #2 with its front. Vehicle #1 came to rest in the eastbound land facing west Vehicle #2 was knocked backwards 33meters coming to rest on its side, in the center of the roadway, facing eastward.This crash occurred on a two lane undivided roadway slightly curving to the left with no grade and a posted speed limit of  72KMPH (45MPH). This crash occurred on a weekday afternoon.

This crash occurred on a two lane undivided roadway, slightly curving to the right, with radius of 375 meters and a super-elevation of 6.3%.  The posted speed limit was 72KMPH (45MPH). The side roadway from which Vehicle #2 was traveling was a two lane undivided roadway curving to the left with a radius of  94 meters and a super elevation of  4.4%. The roadways were dry and the weather was cloudy. This crash occurred on a  weekday evening.Vehicle #1, 2002 Toyota Sienna, was traveling west on the two lane undivided roadway negotiating the curve when it impacted with the left side of Vehicle #2, a 2000 Subaru Forester, with it's front.The Toyota Sienna, (Vehicle #1) was driven by a belted 41year old male who was not injured. The driver stated he thought the other vehicle would wait at its stop sign and not pull out in front of him. The driver stated he steered to his right and braked but was unable to avoid impact.

The crash occurred in the northbound lane of a T-intersection with a grass median.  There was one northbound left-turn only lane with a traffic control and two eastbound lanes with the same traffic control signal.  Conditions were overcast with rain with light fog in the early afternoon of a weekday.  The roadway had a posted speed of 45 MPH.     Vehicle 1 was a 1988 Mercedes Benz 300SL stopped for the traffic control intending on turning left.  Vehicle 2 was a 2002 Mercury Mountaineer driving eastbound in the right lane approaching the traffic control.  The light for the Mercedes turned green and the vehicle started turning left when the front of the Mercury struck the left-front corner of the Mercedes.  The Mercedes rotated CCW 90 degrees and the vehicle's final rest was facing east in the eastbound lane.  Final rest for the Mercury was facing east in the eastbound lane as well.

The crash occurred in the northbound side of a six lane physically divided north/southbound highway, three southbound and three northbound lanes. During the time of the crash the highway was under construction, approaching a work zone, lane three was closed allowing access to lanes one and two. There were traffic barricades blocking lane one.  	The concrete highway was dry, level, and there was no adverse weather conditions. The posted speed limit was 89kmph (55mph). The crash occurred early afternoon and the full access controlled highway had a consistent flow of traffic. 	V1, a 2005 Mitsubishi Lancer was traveling north and had entered lane two of the work zone when its front-end struck the rear of V2, a, 1999 Ford F-350 pick-up. The driver of V1,a 56 year old male stated that he had merged into lane two and preceded driving several feet when V2 suddenly stopped in front of him causing V1 to rear-end V2. The driver of V2, a 49-year-old female said that she was traveling at a consistent speed of approximately 64 kmph (40 mph) when she was rear-ended by V1. V1 was towed due to damages and all three occupants were transported to the hospital for minor injuries.

This two-vehicle crash occurred during daylight hours at a three-legged intersection. The north/south roadway was straight, level and undivided with a speed limit of 72 kmph (45 mph).and the east/west roadway is straight, level and undivided with a speed limit of 40 kmph (25 mph). The southbound travel lanes consists of a right turn lane, two through lanes and a left turn lane. The east/west roadway consists of two lanes, one in each direction, with a stop sign controlling the entry to the north/south roadway. There were no adverse weather conditions at the time.Vehicle one, a 2003 Mazda Protege, was eastbound, turning right at the intersection. Vehicle two, a 1995 Jeep Grand Cherokee, was southbound in the right through lane. As vehicle one turned right, the front left was struck by the front of vehicle two. Vehicle one rotated clockwise and vehicle two rotated counterclockwise and the left side of vehicle one struck the right side of vehicle two. Vehicle one came to rest south of the intersection facing northeast. Vehicle two continued to rotate and rolled over four quarter-turns to the right before coming to rest facing northeast. Both vehicles were towed due to damage.The driver of vehicle one, an eighty-two-year-old female, was driving from a financial institution to her home. The vehicle was new to her, but she claimed to be comfortable driving it. She was also quite familiar with the route that she was traveling. She doesn't remember the stop sign, nor does she remember looking left to check for traffic before she made the right turn.
